annotations.description: Most of the fans probably aren't overly pleased with the development of the game as it wasn't very exciting. It was an even match on the whole, with both sides enjoying spells in the ascendancy. The home team tried to find the weakness in the opposition's defence mostly using rapid counter attacks, while the away team played possession football.

We can hope that the managers will be able to motivate the players and stir them to improve their performance for after the half time break. We haven't seen really exciting football in the previous 45 minutes. Even first half from both sides, and they've both had chances. Both sides are using combination football to try and gain the upper hand.

Ashley Westwood (Aston Villa) releases a powerful first time effort from the edge of the box which goes in the direction of the left hand post, but the keeper leaps like a salmon to deny him. Excellent goalkeeping!

Willian (Chelsea) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, but it is straight at Brad Guzan.

Pedro (Chelsea) trips an opposition player and Roger East signals a foul.
Great teamplay by Chelsea as they control the ball with a lot of short passes. Patience is the key if they want to find a gap in the defence to score.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: Goal! It's a catastrophic error from the opponent which has gifted a chance to Diego Costa (Chelsea), who rolls the ball into the back of the net from close range. 1:0.

John Terry (Chelsea) shows good awareness deep inside the box as he latches on to a cross from the resulting free kick. He jumps high but his towering header lacks accuracy and flies well over the crossbar.

Rudy Gestede (Aston Villa) squandered a big chance from inside the box, firing his volley narrowly over the bar. What a waste. The ball goes out of play and Chelsea will have a goal kick.
Kurt Zouma (Chelsea) unleashes a shot from a mid range free kick that crashes into the defensive wall. The opposition's goalkeeper set it up perfectly.

Joleon Lescott (Aston Villa) carelessly slides into the feet of his opponent and he'll be lucky to avoid punishment. Roger East blows for the foul but keeps his cards in his pocket on this occasion. Another situation results in a direct free kick for Chelsea.

Good afternoon, ladies and gentleman! Welcome to our live text commentary, where we will provide you with instant updates of everything that happens in the match.

Most of the fans probably aren't overly pleased with the development of the game as it wasn't very exciting. It was an even match on the whole, with both sides enjoying spells in the ascendancy. The home team tried to find the weakness in the opposition's defence mostly using rapid counter attacks, while the away team played possession football.
